property.display: Heap size (bytes) - A minimum of 4K (0x1000) is required if standard library functions are to be used.

constraint.display: Value must be 0 or an integer multiple of 8 between 8 and 0xFFFFFFFF. A minimum of 4K (0x1000) is required if standard library functions are to be used.

option.display: IWDT is automatically activated after a reset (Autostart mode)

Automatically activate WDT after a reset (auto-start mode)
Stop WDT after a reset (register-start mode)
Stop counting when entering Sleep mode
Voltage monitor 0 reset is enabled after reset
Voltage monitor 0 reset is disabled after reset
HOCO oscillation is enabled after reset
HOCO oscillation is disabled after reset

config.content: #define BSP_BOARD_S3A7_DK #define BSP_CFG_MCU_PART_PACKAGE (${config.board.s3a7dk.package}) #define BSP_CFG_MCU_PART_MEMORY_SIZE (${config.board.s3a7dk.memory}) #define BSP_CFG_MCU_PART_CORE (${config.board.s3a7dk.core}) #define BSP_CFG_MCU_PART_SERIES (${config.board.s3a7dk.series}) #define BSP_CFG_STACK_MAIN_BYTES (${config.board.s3a7dk.main}) #define BSP_CFG_STACK_PROCESS_BYTES (${config.board.s3a7dk.process}) #define BSP_CFG_HEAP_BYTES (${config.board.s3a7dk.heap}) #define OFS_SEQ1 0xA001A001 | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.iwdt_start_mode}) | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.iwdt_timeout}) #define OFS_SEQ2 (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.iwdt_divisor}) | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.iwdt_window_end}) | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.iwdt_window_start}) #define OFS_SEQ3 (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.iwdt_reset_interrupt}) | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.iwdt_stop_control}) | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.wdt_start_mode}) #define OFS_SEQ4 (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.wdt_timeout}) |(${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.wdt_divisor}) | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.wdt_window_end}) | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.wdt_window_start}) #define OFS_SEQ5 (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.wdt_reset_interrupt}) | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS0.wdt_stop_control}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_OFS0 (OFS_SEQ1 | OFS_SEQ2 | OFS_SEQ3 | OFS_SEQ4 | OFS_SEQ5) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_OFS1 (0xFFFFFEC3 | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS1.voltage_detection0.start}) | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS1.voltage_detection0_level}) | (${config.mcu.s3a7.OFS1.hoco_osc})) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_PC0_ENABLE (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_pc0_enable}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_PC0_START (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_pc0_start}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_PC0_END (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_pc0_end}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_PC1_ENABLE (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_pc1_enable}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_PC1_START (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_pc1_start}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_PC1_END (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_pc1_end}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION0_ENABLE (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg0_enable}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION0_START (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg0_start}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION0_END (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg0_end}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION1_ENABLE (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg1_enable}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION1_START (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg1_start}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION1_END (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg1_end}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION2_ENABLE (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg2_enable}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION2_START (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg2_start}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION2_END (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg2_end}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION3_ENABLE (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg3_enable}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION3_START (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg3_start}) #define BSP_CFG_ROM_REG_MPU_REGION3_END (${config.board.s3a7dk.mpu_reg3_end}) #define BSP_CFG_ID_CODE_LONG_1 (${config.board.s3a7dk.id1}) #define BSP_CFG_ID_CODE_LONG_2 (${config.board.s3a7dk.id2}) #define BSP_CFG_ID_CODE_LONG_3 (${config.board.s3a7dk.id3}) #define BSP_CFG_ID_CODE_LONG_4 (${config.board.s3a7dk.id4}) #define BSP_CFG_MCU_VCC_MV (${config.board.common.vcc}) #define BSP_CFG_PARAM_CHECKING_ENABLE (${config.board.common.checking}) #define BSP_CFG_RTOS (${config.board.common.rtos}) #define BSP_CFG_ASSERT (${config.board.common.assert}) #define BSP_CFG_ERROR_LOG (${config.board.common.error_log})

option.display: Priority 15 (lowest, not valid if using ThreadX)

node.tooltip: Click to edit the XTAL frequency.
The system clock (ICLK) is used as the operating clock of the CPU, DMAC, DTC, ROM and RAM.
The Peripheral clock A (PCLKA) is used as the operating clock for the ETHER, USBHS, QSPI, RSPI, SCI, TSIP, GLCD, SDHI, CRC, JPEG, G2D, GPT and Standby-RAM modules.
The Peripheral clock B (PCLKB) is used as the operating clock for all other modules not supported by PCLKA, PCLKC and PCLKD.
The Peripheral clock C (PCLKC) is used as the operating clock for the ADC modules.
The Peripheral clock D (PCLKD) is used as the operating clock for the GPT module.
The external bus clock (BCLK) is an operating clock for the external bus controller.\nIt is also output externally from the BCLK pin for the external connection bus.
Whether to output the BCLK frequency on the BCLKOUT pin.

The flash-interface clock (FCLK) is used as the operating clock for the flash-memory interfaces.\nThat is, FCLK is used for programming and erasure of the ROM and E2 DataFlash, and reading from the E2 DataFlash.
The USB clock (UCLK) is an operating clock for the USBFS module.\nA 48-MHz clock must be supplied to the USB module.\nWhen the USB module is used, setting must be made so that UCLK is 48 MHz.
